stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on maintenance and polishing work: restoring Course 7 (career 7) to full functionality, creating new overworld terrain and textures, and preparing for a playable Luigi addition. Much of the stream shows him wrestling with new development tools after upgrading to Windows 11, and refining mushroom‐themed assets for the forest section of the overworld.

development_findings.summary: Course 7 has been updated (sounds, assets) and now works again on real N64 hardware; only the five Yoshi coins still need to be placed.
development_findings.quote: Career 7 is now fully functional again. I just need to add the five Yoshi coins.

development_findings.summary: Mario’s head/model was finally repaired and integrated into the build.
development_findings.quote: I also fixed Mario's head, finally. This new model.

development_findings.summary: Kaze switched toolchain after moving to Windows 11: DaVinci Resolve (video), Blender 4.2 with official hotkeys, and a custom fork of Project64 whose main improvement is working audio.
development_findings.quote: Instead of Sony Vegas, I now use DaVinci Resolve. And I'm now on Blender 4.2… I also have a completely custom version of Project 64 now… the audio actually works.

development_findings.summary: The Windows 11 upgrade freed disk space but introduced instability (blue screens) and major slow-downs in Blender, impacting development pace.
development_findings.quote: I updated to Windows 11… I also have had two blue screens since I updated.

development_findings.summary: Plan to make Luigi a playable character soon, using Pixelpalabra’s model styled after Biobak’s Mario. Memory must be freed by deleting unused files before import.
development_findings.quote: I'm probably importing the Luigi this week… It will open up enough memory for Luigi to fit into RAM.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 cannot exploit ambient light colours as desired; Kaze opts to add real N64 lights via manual actor setup instead.
development_findings.quote: Yeah, you can't use the light color in Fast64… I can add an actual light coming from underneath instead.

development_findings.summary: Kaze confirmed widescreen support costs only ~2–3 FPS (e.g., 36 → 33 FPS) on real hardware.
development_findings.quote: We got 36 FPS… turn on widescreen… 33.5. So not that much of a difference.

development_findings.summary: Demonstrated texture-pipeline constraints: CI4 16-colour limit, need for proper coloured transparency, and bilinear filtering artefacts; he uses GIMP to create a mushroom-cluster floor texture and warns that AI-generated textures are not production-ready.
development_findings.quote: Photoshop cannot put colour in transparent pixels… AI texture generation is nowhere near the level where it can actually be used.

development_findings.summary: Overworld work: finished forest section (mushroom ground, 3-D mushroom decals); upcoming tasks include Bowser’s oil-tanker area, wave effects, and background skybox.
development_findings.quote: That finishes part 10… then there's just 11, 12 and 13 left… we still need to make Bowser's oil tanker… and waves and stuff.

development_findings.summary: Potential future paid side-project: a 120-star ‘Groots’ major hack built in about a month for a $5,000 commission.
development_findings.quote: Someone wants me to make a ROM hack based off the Groots… If the guy pays $5,000 for it, then I mean, it's a good enough deal.

context_findings.summary: Kaze feels low motivation and fatigue, attributing clearer thinking to quitting morning pre-workout stimulants.
context_findings.quote: It is crazy how I feel like I can speak and think so much clearer when I don't take pre-workout… Maybe pre-workout has been making me stupid.

context_findings.summary: He is frustrated yet amused by Windows 11 and new Blender hotkeys, openly venting on stream.
context_findings.quote: The new hotkeys are really rough to get used to for me… Holy shit, maybe it's because I'm streaming that Blender slowed down so much.

context_findings.summary: Shows practical but humorous obsession with time-saving tech (automatic lawnmower), using it as a metaphor for valuing personal time.
context_findings.quote: $600 for an automatic lawnmower is only a bad deal if your time is almost worthless.

biobak.summary: Created the current Mario model; consulted on lighting solutions and teased upcoming ‘Divine Dino Domain’ assets.

zeina.summary: Supplied mushroom-cluster texture assets and will adjust them (transparent grass removal) per Kaze’s request.

key_stories.title: Windows 11 Migration Mayhem
key_stories.summary: Kaze upgraded to Windows 11 to reclaim disk space and update software, but the move caused blue screens and severe Blender slow-downs that stalled development during the stream.
key_stories.challenge: Running out of disk space and an unstable Windows 10 install.
key_stories.process: Installed Windows 11, updated Blender and other tools live on stream, troubleshooting crashes while modeling.
key_stories.outcome: Recovered some workflow but identified new instability issues that must be solved off-stream.
key_stories.key_quote: I updated to Windows 11… I also have had two blue screens since I updated.

key_stories.title: Fitting Luigi Into N64 Memory
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants to add a fully-modeled Luigi this week, but the game’s ROM is near memory limits. He plans to delete unused assets to make room.
key_stories.challenge: N64 RAM limits prevent simply importing Pixelpalabra’s Luigi model.
key_stories.process: Clean out unused Return to Yoshi’s Island files to reclaim memory, then import and test the Luigi model.
key_stories.outcome: Task scheduled for the coming days; success would bring a second playable character.
key_stories.key_quote: Maybe tomorrow I can start cleaning out some unused files… It will open up enough memory for Luigi to fit into RAM.

key_stories.title: The Mushroom Texture Gauntlet
key_stories.summary: Kaze and Zeina collaborate on creating a seamless mushroom floor texture that meets strict CI4 16-colour and transparency requirements while running on real hardware.
key_stories.challenge: Generate a visually rich yet RAM-friendly texture without white-edge artefacts, amid tool limitations and AI hype.
key_stories.process: Reject AI attempts, use GIMP to palette-reduce, manually set 1 % opaque background colour, and iterate on palette bugs.
key_stories.outcome: A working mushroom ground texture and 3-D mushroom decals integrated into the overworld forest.
key_stories.key_quote: AI texture generation is nowhere near the level where it can actually be used… Photoshop will always give you white outlines.

open_questions.context: Kaze mentions a bespoke emulator build with working audio.
questions: What specific features did you add or modify in your Project64 fork?
How does this custom emulator assist development or debugging on real hardware?

open_questions.context: Need to prune assets to import Luigi.
questions: Beyond a model swap, will Luigi have unique abilities or physics?
What tools or profiling do you use to track N64 memory usage?
How do team members coordinate asset optimization?
Could memory constraints affect future content (e.g., co-op mode)?

open_questions.context: Next overworld segment to be built.
questions: What visual or thematic inspirations guide the oil-tanker concept?
Any new mechanics or technical tricks planned for this area?
How do you balance realism with Mario-style whimsy here?

open_questions.context: Kaze publicly rejects current AI asset generation.
questions: Under what conditions, if any, would you adopt AI tools?
Do you foresee ethical or quality standards evolving to make AI acceptable?
How does community perception shape these technical decisions?

open_questions.context: Fast64 cannot use certain ambient light settings.
questions: What work-arounds are you developing for advanced lighting?
Could changes to Fast64 source fix this, or is it an engine limit?
How does lighting design interplay with Biobak’s texture work?

open_questions.context: Potential $5 k commissioned 120-star hack in one month.
questions: What criteria do you consider before accepting such side projects?
How would this sprint impact Return to Yoshi’s Island scheduling?
What pipeline tricks allow a full major hack so quickly?
